  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)

components.docs:
`<bbj-app-layout>` is a responsive layout component that provides a header, a footer, a drawer, and content.
The header and footer are fixed, the drawer slides in and out of the viewport, and the content is scrollable.

This component can be used to build common application layouts, such as a dashboard.

props.name: drawerBreakpoint
props.docs:
A media query to control when the drawer will be switched to popover mode.

Useful for small screens. By default the drawer popover mode will be enabled
when the screen size is `800px` or less.

props.name: drawerFooterVisible
props.docs: When true, the drawer will show the footer section.

props.name: drawerHeaderVisible
props.docs: When true, the drawer will show the header section.

props.name: drawerOpened
props.docs: When true, the drawer is opened, otherwise it is closed.

props.name: drawerOverlay
props.docs: When true and the `drawerPopover` is enabled, the drawer will have an overlay behind it when it is opened.

props.name: drawerPlacement
props.docs: The drawer position.

props.name: drawerPopover
props.docs: When true, the drawer will pop over the header, footer and the content area.

props.name: fitViewport
props.docs:
When true, the content area will fill the viewport height, otherwise the content area will be scrollable.

When setting this property to `true` you should make the `html` and `body` elements
non-scrollable.

props.name: footerFixed
props.docs: When true, the footer will be fixed at the top and won't move when the user scrolls.

props.name: footerOffscreen
props.docs: When true, the footer position will be shifted to fit beside the opened drawer.

props.name: footerReveal
props.docs: When true, the footer will be revealed when the user scrolls up and hidden when scrolls down.

props.name: footerShadow
props.docs:
When set to `scroll`, the footer will have a shadow after revealing.
When set to `always`, the shadow will always be visible, otherwise, it's hidden.

props.name: headerFixed
props.docs: When true, the header will be fixed at the top and won't move when the user scrolls.

props.name: headerOffscreen
props.docs: When true, the header position will be shifted to fit beside the opened drawer.

props.name: headerReveal
props.docs: When true, the header will be revealed when the user scrolls up and hidden when scrolls down.

props.name: headerShadow
props.docs:
When set to `scroll`, the header will have a shadow after revealing.
Alternatively, when set to `always`, the shadow will always be visible; otherwise, it remains hidden.

styles.name: --bbj-app-layout-drawer-width
styles.docs: The width of the drawer to be used in the layout. By default, the width will be auto-calculated.

styles.name: --bbj-app-layout-footer-collapse-height
styles.docs: The minimum height of the footer when it is hidden. Used to create a sticky footer.

styles.name: --bbj-app-layout-footer-height
styles.docs: The padding of the content to be used in the layout. By default, the padding will be auto-calculated.

styles.name: --bbj-app-layout-header-collapse-height
styles.docs: The minimum height of the header when it is hidden. Used to create a sticky header.

An array of supported of highlight behaviors.

  3. REQUEST : Contents of the component are automatically highlighted when the component receives focus programmatically by calling the `setFocus` method.

props.name: validator
props.docs:
A Javascript expression or function to validate the component. If the expression has the `return` keyword in it, then it is used as is; if not, then wrap it with `return` and `;` to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: the component's value
  2. `x`: Alias for value
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, same as `value`
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component
  5. `control`: Alias for component

props.name: value

props.name: wrap
props.docs:
Indicates how the component will wrap the text. Possible values are:
  1. `hard`: The browser automatically inserts line breaks `(CR+LF)` so that each line has no more than the width of the component; the cols attribute must also be specified for this to take effect.
  2. `soft`: The browser ensures that all line breaks in the value consist of a `CR+LF` pair, but does not insert any additional line breaks.
  3. `off` : Like soft but changes appearance to white-space: pre so line segments exceeding cols are not wrapped and the `

components.docs:
The `{{CONTROL_NAME}}<bbj-dialog>` creates a {{CONTROL_NAME_WITH_LINK}} dialog box.

{{#eq CONTROL_NAME "MSGBOX"}}
 **Syntax:** `MSGBOX(str1{,expr{,str2{,button1{,button2{,button3}}}}}{,MODE="options"}{,TIM=int}{,ERR=lineref})`

 ```BBj
   selected = msgbox("This is the message", 0, "MessageBox", mode="blurred=true,button-0-theme=gray")
 ```

Each attribute listed in the table below can be passed to the `MSGBOX` dialog using the `MODE` option.
For example, `mode="blurred=true"` will set the dialog to be blurred.

The `MSGBOX` dialog uses `BBjButton<bbj-button>` to render the buttons. Any supported [`BBjButton<bbj-button>`](dwc/BBjButton.md) attributes can
also be passed to the `MSGBOX` function using the `MODE` option. In this case, the attribute must be prefixed with `button-` followed by the button
index (starting from 0). For example, `button-0-theme=gray` will set the first button theme to `gray`.

{{/eq}}

{{#eq CONTROL_NAME "PROMPT"}}
 **Syntax:** `PROMPT(message{,default{,title{,expr}}}{,MODE="options"}{,TIM=int}{,ERR=lineref})`

```BBj
  password$ = prompt("Enter your password","","Credentials Required",0, mode="input-type=PASSWORD,blurred=true,button-0-theme=gray")
```
Each attribute listed in the table below can be passed to the `PROMPT` dialog using the `MODE` option. For example, `mode="blurred=true"` will set the
dialog to be blurred.

The `PROMPT` dialog uses [`BBjButton<bbj-button>`](dwc/BBjButton.md) to render the buttons and
[`BBjEditBox<bbj-editbox>`](dwc/BBjEditBox.md) to render the input. Any supported [`BBjButton<bbj-button>`](dwc/BBjButton.md) attributes can also be
passed to the `PROMPT` function using the `MODE` option. In this case, the attribute must be prefixed with `button-` followed by the button index
(starting from 0). For example, `button-0-theme=gray` will set the first button theme to `gray`. The same applies to the input box. Any supported
[`BBjEditBox<bbj-editbox>`](dwc/BBjEditBox.md) attributes can be passed to the `PROMPT` function using the `MODE` option. In this case, the attribute
must be prefixed with `input-`. For example, `input-type=PASSWORD` will set the input type to `password`.

{{/eq}}

props.name: typeToSelectTimeout
props.docs:
Typing into the list accumulates keystrokes entered within a specified number of milliseconds into a 'typeahead'
buffer. This allows the user to, for example, jump directly to New York in a list of all 50 states
by typing "NY". Without this 'typeahead' buffer, the user would have to press "N" eight times to skip
past the other state codes beginning with "N."

The default time window for this feature is 1000 milliseconds (1 second).

  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:

    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.docs:
A sorting criteria. For instance (+name , -length).

Supported sorting criteria are: `name`, `length` and `modified`.
The sorting criteria can be prefixed with a `+` or `-` to indicate ascending or descending order.
If no prefix is given then column will not be sorted.

docsTags.text:
The type of the file chooser.

When `save` then the file chooser will be used to save a file, directory or both depending on the `selectionMode`
property. In this case the file chooser will have an input field to enter the file/directory name.
When `open` then the file chooser will be used to open a file, directory or both depending on the `selectionMode`
property.

buffer. The default time window for this feature is 1000 milliseconds (1 second)

components.docs:
The `<bbj-icon>` provides methods for displaying a UI icon.

An icon is a unelectable SVG image that represents an application, a capability, or some other concept or
specific entity with meaning for the user.

BBj does not bundle an icons library by default. but it configure several icons pools that the user can choose from.
Then the icons will be loaded from a CDN on demand.


## Configured Pools

BBj configures the following list of pools which can be used with `bbj-icon`

1. [Tabler](https://tabler-icons.io/)
2. [Feather](https://feathericons.com/)
3. [fa (Font Awesome Free)](https://fontawesome.com/)
4. and `bbj` which is a small subset of Tabler Icons


## Usage

You can use this component like this:

```html
<bbj-icon pool="POOL_NAME" name="ICON_NAME"></bbj-icon>
```

?> **Note:**: The default pool name is `tabler`

In BBj you can use it through the `BBjStaticText` control like this:

```BBj
wnd!.addStaticText(101,50,100,90,30,"<html><bbj-icon name=""alien""></bbj-icon></html>",$0000$)
```

### Custom Pools

You can register additional pools to use with `bbj-icon`.

```javascript
(window.BBj ??= {}).IconsPools ??= [];
window.BBj.IconsPools.push({
  name: 'POOL_NAME',
  resolver: name => {return 'SVG_URL'}
});
````

For instance , This is how the [feather pool](https://feathericons.com/) is registered.
```javascript
(window.BBj ??= {}).IconsPools ??= [];
window.BBj.IconsPools.push({
  name: 'feather',
  resolver: name => `https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/feather-icons@4.28.0/dist/icons/${name}.svg`
});
````

Then in your code

```html
<bbj-icon pool="feather" name="activity"></bbj-icon>
```

## BBj Pool

All used icons in BBj components use the `bbj` pool , You can override the pool like this:

``` javascript
const BBjIcons = {
'calendar': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-calendar" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <rect x="4" y="5" width="16" height="16" rx="2"/> <line x1="16" y1="3" x2="16" y2="7"/> <line x1="8" y1="3" x2="8" y2="7"/> <line x1="4" y1="11" x2="20" y2="11"/> <line x1="11" y1="15" x2="12" y2="15"/> <line x1="12" y1="15" x2="12" y2="18"/></svg>`,
'check': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-check" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <path d="M5 12l5 5l10 -10"/></svg>`,
'chevron-down': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-down" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="6 9 12 15 18 9"/></svg>`,
'chevron-left': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-left" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="15 6 9 12 15 18"/></svg>`,
'chevron-right': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-right" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="9 6 15 12 9 18"/></svg>`,

'chevrons-left': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevrons-left" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"></path><polyline points="11 7 6 12 11 17"></polyline><polyline points="17 7 12 12 17 17"></polyline></svg>`,
```

components.docs: `BBjInfiniteScroll<bbj-infinite-scroll>` Loads content continuously as the user scrolls down, eliminating the need for pagination.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: content -  The component content (can be used to create custom loading message)

props.name: completed
props.docs: When true, the component will not ask to load any more items.

props.name: icon
props.docs:
The refresh icon to use when loading more data. The icon can be in any of the following formats:
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `folder`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:folder`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'spinner'}
    2. {pool: 'feather' name: 'spinner}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.docs:
An array of supported of highlight behaviors.
  1. KEY : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control receives focus by tabbing into it.
  2. MOUSE : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control receives focus by clicking into it with the mouse.
  3. REQUEST : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control receives focus programmatically by calling the `setFocus` method.

props.name: validationIcon
props.docs:
The icon to use with the validation message
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'x'}
    2. {pool: 'feather', name: 'x'}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.name: validationPopoverDistance
props.docs: The distance in pixels to offset the validation message away from the control.

props.name: validationPopoverPlacement
props.docs: Describes the preferred placement of the validation message.

props.name: validationPopoverSkidding
props.docs: The distance in pixels to offset the validation message along the control.

props.name: validationStyle
props.docs: When `popover`, the invalid message will be displayed as a popover Otherwise , it's displayed as an inline message.

props.name: validator
props.docs:
A javascript expression or function to validate the control. if the expression has the 'return' keyword in it, then we use as is, if not, then wrap it with return and ';' to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: The control's value as [Date](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date)
  2. `x`: Alias for value
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, Date string as typed by the user.
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component
  5. `control`: Alias for component

An array of supported of highlight behaviors.

props.name: validationIcon
props.docs:
The icon to use with the validation message
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'x'}
    2. {pool: 'feather', name: 'x'}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.name: validationPopoverDistance
props.docs: The distance in pixels to offset the validation message away from the control.

props.name: validationPopoverPlacement
props.docs: Describes the preferred placement of the validation message.

props.name: validationPopoverSkidding
props.docs: The distance in pixels to offset the validation message along the control.

props.name: validationStyle
props.docs: When `popover`, the invalid message will be displayed as a popover; otherwise it will be shown as an inline message.

props.name: validator
props.docs:
A javascript expression or function to validate the control. if the expression has the 'return' word in it, then we use as is, if not, then wrap it with return and ';' to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: The control's unmasked value.
  2. `x`: Alias for value.
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, same as `value`.
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component.
  5. `control`: Alias for component.

props.name: maskRounding
props.docs:
When the control is programmatically set to a value that
exceeds the mask precision, the value is truncated, not rounded. For example, if the mask
is "###,###,##0.00-", then programmatically setting the control value to -12345.6789 will
cause it to display "12,345.67-", the same value that it would show if the user attempted
to type those characters directly into the control.
This differs from the standard Numeric Output rules, which would round to "12,345.68-".
Setting this attribute to "TRUE" will cause the
input to round values that exceed the mask precision, consistent with standard numeric output rules.

An array of supported of highlight behaviors.
  1. KEY : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control gets focus by tabbing into it.
  2. MOUSE : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control gets focus by clicking into it with the mouse.
  3. REQUEST : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control gets focus under program control by calling the `setFocus` method.

props.name: step
props.docs:
The interval in seconds between the time values displayed in the dropdown.

It specifies how frequently the time values are generated.
For example, if step is set to 1800 (30 minutes), the generated
items will contain time values at 30-minute intervals throughout the day.

props.name: tabTraversable

props.name: valid
props.docs: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

props.name: validationIcon
props.docs:
The icon to use with the validation message
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'x'}
    2. {pool: 'feather', name: 'x'}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.docs: When `popover`,  the invalid message will be displayed as a popover, as an inline message otherwise.

props.name: validator
props.docs:
A Javascript expression or function to validate the control. If the expression has the 'return' keyword in it, then it is used as is; if not, then wrap it with `return` and ';' to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: The control's
  2. `x`: Alias for value
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, same as `value`
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component
  5. `control`: Alias for component

props.name: typeToSelectTimeout
props.docs:
Typing into the list accumulates keystrokes entered within a specified number of milliseconds into a typeahead
buffer. This allows the user, for example, to jump directly to New York in a list of all 50 states
by typing "NY". Without this typeahead buffer, the user would have to press "N" eight times to skip
past the other state codes beginning with "N."

The default time window for this feature is 1000 milliseconds (1 second).

An array of supported of highlight behaviors.

  2. MOUSE : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control receives focus by clicking into it with the mouse.
  3. REQUEST : Contents of the control are automatically highlighted when the control receives focus programmatically by calling the `setFocus` method.

props.name: valid
props.docs: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

props.name: validationIcon
props.docs:
The icon to use with the validation message
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'x'}
    2. {pool: 'feather', name: 'x'}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.name: validationPopoverDistance
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the validation message away from the control.

props.name: validationPopoverPlacement
props.docs: Describes the preferred placement of the validation message.

props.name: validationPopoverSkidding
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the validation message along the control.

props.name: validationStyle
props.docs: When `popover` , then the invalid message will be displayed as a popover, as an inline message otherwise

props.name: validator
props.docs:
A Javascript expression or function to validate the control. If the expression has the 'return' keyword in it, then it is used as is; if not, then wrap it with `return` and ';' to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: The control's
  2. `x`: Alias for value
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, same as `value`
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component
  5. `control`: Alias for component

components.docs:
The `BBjNavigator/<bbj-navigator>` provides methods for manipulating a UI navigator control.

## Text Expressions

All text properties `textFirst` , `textFirst` , `textLast` , `textNumbered` , ... are evaluated as Javascript expressions.
The text expression is evaluated with the following parameters:

- `component`: The current component instance.
- `control`: Alias for `component`.
- `current`: The current page number.
- `x`: Alias for `current`.
-  `startIndex`: The start index of the current page.
- `endIndex`: The end index of the current page.
- `startPage`: The index of the first page
- `endPage`: The index of the last page
- `totalPages`: The total number of pages.
- `totalItems`:The total number of items.

For instance

```javascript
component.textPreview = `Showing ${startIndex}-${endIndex} of ${totalItems}`
```

props.name: activation
props.docs:
When set to auto, radio buttons will be selected when they gain focus for any reason. When set to
 manual, radio buttons will not be selected when they gain focus programmatically or by user keyboard operation (LEFT,  RIGHT, UP, DOWN arrows within a group).

props.name: autoValidate
props.docs: When true, the control will be validated with every change.

props.name: autoValidateOnLoad
props.docs: When true, the control will be validated when it is loaded for the first time.

props.name: autoWasValidated
props.docs: When true, the control will switch the `valid` property automatically after the control is validated and became valid.

props.name: checked
props.docs: When true, the radio button is checked , false otherwise

props.name: disabled
props.docs: True to disable the radio button , false to enable it

props.name: expanse
props.docs: The component's expanse.

props.name: hasFocus
props.docs: When true,  the radio button is focused , false otherwise

props.docs: Set to true to indicate that the user input is invalid.

props.name: invalidMessage
props.docs: An error message to present to the user when the control is invalid

props.name: label
props.docs: The radio button label

props.name: name
props.docs:
The radio button name

A radio group is defined by giving each of radio buttons in the group the same name. Once a radio group is established, selecting any radio button in that group automatically deselects any currently-selected radio button in the same group.

You can have as many radio groups on a page as you like, as long as each has its own unique name.

For example, if your form needs to ask the user for their preferred contact method, you might create three radio buttons, each with the name property set to contact but one with the value email, one with the value phone, and one with the value mail.

The user never sees the value or the name unless you expressly add code to display it.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: When true, put the radio button in readonly mode.

props.name: required
props.docs: When true, a value is required or must be check for the form to be submittable.

props.name: switch
props.docs: When true, the radio button will be rendered as a switch.

props.name: tabTraversable
props.docs: Indicates that the element can be focused. A negative value means that the element is not reachable via sequential keyboard navigation.

props.name: valid
props.docs: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

props.name: validationIcon
props.docs:
The icon to use with the validation message
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'x'}
    2. {pool: 'feather', name: 'x'}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.name: validationPopoverDistance
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the validation message away from the control.

props.name: validationPopoverPlacement
props.docs: Describes the preferred placement of the validation message.

props.name: validationPopoverSkidding
props.docs: The distance in pixels from which to offset the validation message along the control.

props.name: validationStyle
props.docs: When `popover`, the invalid message will be displayed as a popover, as an inline message otherwise.

props.name: validator
props.docs:
A Javascript expression or function to validate the control. If the expression has the 'return' keyword in it, then it is used as is; if not, then wrap it with `return` and ';' to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: The control's
  2. `x`: Alias for value
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, same as `value`
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component
  5. `control`: Alias for component

components.docs:
`BBjPullToRefresh<bbj-refresher>` lets a user pull down on a container using
touch in order to refresh or retrieve more data.

Pull-to-refresh is widely used on devices with a touch screen.
You can use the APIs shown here to implement pull-to-refresh in your app.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: When true,  the refresher will be disabled, enabled otherwise

props.name: iconArrow
props.docs:
The arrow icon to use when the `stage` is `pull` or `release`. The icon can be in any of the following formats:
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `folder`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:folder`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'arrow'}
    2. {pool: 'feather' name: 'arrow}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.name: iconRefresh
props.docs:
The refresh icon to use when the `stage` is `refresh`. The icon can be in any of the following formats:
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default BBj icons pool. (ex: `folder`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:folder`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'spinner'}
    2. {pool: 'feather' name: 'spinner}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

props.name: stage
props.docs: The current refresher stage.

props.docs: The minimum distance of the pull until the refresher will go into the release state.

props.name: thresholdMax
props.docs: The maximum distance of the pull.

methods.name: finish
methods.docs: Put the refresh in the `initial` stage

events.docs: Fired when the target is being is pulled. The event payload contains the height of the refresher

Fired when the refresh is requested.

This event must be handled and when the refresh is done , the `finish` method
must be called to return the refresher to the `initial` state.

components.docs:
A streamlined Table component designed for rendering tables with multiple rows and columns.
This table is equipped with features such as sorting, selection, and virtualization, along with
the ability to customize cell rendering. It's crafted to offer both high customization
and performance.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: table-wrapper - The entire container that wraps the table and its elements.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: table - The primary table element, housing all content including headers, rows, and cells.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: header - The top part of the table that contains column headers and controls like sorting icons and checkboxes.

docsTags.name: part

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: cell-header - Individual cells located in the header row, typically containing labels or titles for the columns.

docsTags.name: part

docsTags.name: part

props.name: checkboxSelection
props.docs:
When false, the table won't render the selection
checkboxes for each row.

This option works only when `multiSelection` is enabled

props.name: clientSorting
props.docs:
When true, the table will automatically sort the data
when the user clicks on a column header. The default is false.

Use this in case you want to sort the data yourself. The event in
this case will contains the sorting information.

props.name: columnDefinitions
props.docs: An array of objects that defines the columns of the table.

props.name: columnHeaders
props.docs: When true, the column headers are rendered, hidden otherwise.

props.name: data
props.docs: An array of objects that defines the rows of the table.

props.name: deselection
props.docs:
Set to false to prevent rows from being deselected if you hold down Ctrl
and click the row (i.e. once a row is selected, it remains selected
until another row is selected in its place).

By default the table allows deselection of rows.

props.name: getRowId
props.docs: A function or an expression to generate a row id

props.name: headerCheckboxSelection
props.docs: If false, a `select all` checkbox will be added to the header.

props.name: headerHeight
props.docs: The height of the header in pixels.

props.name: isRowSelectable
props.docs:
A function or an expression to be used to determine which rows
are selectable.

By default rows are selectable, so return false to make
a row un-selectable.

props.name: multiSelectWithClick
props.docs:
Set to true to allow multiple rows to be selected with clicks.
For example, if you click to select one row and then click to select
another row, the first row will stay selected as well.
Clicking a selected row in this mode will deselect the row.
This is useful for touch devices where Ctrl and Shift clicking is not an option.

props.name: overscan
props.docs:
The number of rows to pre render beyond the visible scrolling area.
The bigger the number the slower the performance. keep this value small

props.name: rowHeight
props.docs: The height of each row in pixels.

props.name: selected
props.docs: An array of selected row ids.

props.name: selectionMode
props.docs: The selection mode of the table.

components.docs:
A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications.
It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message.

A toast can contain buttons by adding `a` and `button` elements to the message's body. If
any of these elements has the `data-action="close"` attribute then it will behave as a dismiss button.

```html
<bbj-toast message="The application has new update available" opened>
  <button>Update</button>
  <button data-action="close">Later</button>
</bbj-toast>
```

The duration in milliseconds to show the toast.
After that this time is elapsed , the toast will be hidden automatically.
If the duration number is negative the toast will never close automatically
